intro: Platystele jane-lueriana, commonly known as the Jane Luer's ghost plant, is a species of orchid belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is a small, epiphytic plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, leafless stems and small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high air humidity and indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in some areas.
